Lyte: "mah biased poll!"

400 downvotes doesn't outweigh the rest of the 27 million players who didn't downvote/upvote. RIOT can't assume the rest of the community feels the same. The picture is much bigger than these boards and reddit. They have to look at the metrics and values they feel are important for game health, and right now those are telling them the system is healthier than it's predecessor even though many people on the boards don't feel the same.

Does that make your opinion any less important? Of course not. Every opinion matters and it's good you care enough to voice your concern (RIOT appreciates it). Just be realistic about your expectations from RIOT, this is a massive game with a massive community. Such monumental changes aren't decisions made quickly or without careful thought and planning. They may very well choose to change the system again in the future, but right now they are giving Dynamic Que it's chance, particularly while their data is suggesting it's healthier (again, despite what the board community thinks).

400 down votes in a lot for the boards community. Reddit and the boards community represent a small section of the league community, but it is still accurate. This is because people on boards and Reddit are diverse and nonbiased. It is a survey and sample of the whole league's population's opinion. The reason they are keeping it is not because it is healthy, they are keeping it because they want to make more money. Things do change based on opinions on boards and Reddit. Why? Because it does accurately reflect opinions of the community as a whole.

How are the boards an accurate sample? How are the people not biased? Most of the people on the boards are here because they want to complain. Most of those who are content never get on here (I'm only on here because I'm bored and I think most of the threads are funny). So it's not at all surprising that a thread that was placed somewhere that people use to complain got a lot of downvotes.

So just a question if the majority of people don't like the change and everyone hates it, how are they going to make more money from it. I keep seeing this all the time saying that riot only made this change because they are money hunger. But if everyone hates it like you say how are they going to make money?
People who plays with friends tends to buy more stuff. So riot is favoring premades eventhough the community thinks that it is unhealthy.
But if the majority of players are solos that hate these changes then there are not that many people playing with friends and they won't make any money.

It's like reviews on amazon, there may be 400 bad reviews for a particular product, but that doesn't reflect the 27 million people who bought it and love it. Typically those who are angry with something are far more vocal and likely to post threads than those who are satisfied.

It is very possible that the majority of the community DOES agree that Dynamic Que sucks, but that cannot be concluded by the amount of negativity or downvotes on the boards. As I said, RIOT needs to look at data from all sources (including the boards) and determine if the que is successful or not. Right now It seems RIOT believes it is, but that may likely change.

Similar example: putting an approval rating poll for a Democratic president on a Republican website. Of course the approval rating will be low, because the sample was biased.

If they put a poll on the client, then the results would not be nearly as skewed.

"Hey guys, we know there are a lot of players who are really passionate about solo queue. We're not trying to be dishonest or dodge this topic. Radio silence on this the past couple months has been painful, we know. We hoped to come out with a direct answer to this, but working through the problems players are facing on live now (consistency around position select, queue times and matchmaking for high MMR) is taking longer than we initially expected. We did a bad job at managing expectations around this and deserve the heat we're getting around that.

That being said, solo queue does not directly address either of these problems and could suffer from the exact same problems. We'll be honest: there's definitely a world in which solo queue doesn't return, but we'd rather keep it on the table as we work through these issues before making a final decision."
